page.title: 05Ecology of the Area
page.content: The area has a cool northern climate. The winters are not usually too severe; being only 10 miles from the sea, the ambient temperature is a little higher than it is further inland. Summers tend to be considerably cooler than the southern part of Britain. There is very little air pollution either from smoke or chemical sprays. There is a great diversity of wild-life habitat, giving rise to many different species of flora and fauna. The brilliant blue flowers of Meadow Cranesbill (Geranium Pratensa) and the deep pink flowers of the Dog Rose (Rosa Canina) decorate the road-side verges. Hawthorn (Crataegus Monogyna) and Blackthorn (Prunus Spinosa) substitute for fences on some farms.
